name: Vegan Sugar Cookies
description: These vegan sugar cookies are perfect for Christmas and Valentine's Day! They're soft, perfectly sweet, and super easy to make. And it's so much fun to decorate them!
recipeIngredient: 3/4 cup vegan butter  (such as Earth Balance)

recipeInstructions.text: In a mixing bowl, add softened vegan butter and sugar. Beat with a handheld or stand mixer for about 3-4 minutes on high speed until the butter sugar mixture is light and fluffy.
recipeInstructions.name: In a mixing bowl, add softened vegan butter and sugar. Beat with a handheld or stand mixer for about 3-4 minutes on high speed until the butter sugar mixture is light and fluffy.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the vanilla extract, the almond extract, and the soy or almond milk. Beat again on high speed until well combined. This should take about a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the vanilla extract, the almond extract, and the soy or almond milk. Beat again on high speed until well combined. This should take about a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Now add the dry ingredients. Mix again on high until everything is well combined. Do not overmix the batter. Form a ball and cover it with plastic wrap. Place it in the fridge for 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Now add the dry ingredients. Mix again on high until everything is well combined. Do not overmix the batter. Form a ball and cover it with plastic wrap. Place it in the fridge for 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly cover your kitchen counter with flour and roll out the dough with a rolling pin.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly cover your kitchen counter with flour and roll out the dough with a rolling pin.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut out the cookies with cookie cutters. I used star, heart, and Christmas tree shaped cookie cutters. Preheat the oven to 350 °F.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the cookies on top. Bake for 8 minutes. As every oven is a bit different, check regularly, so they don't get too dark.
